article_title: Leaner Return Anticipated for H&R Block
article_text:
When tax-preparation giant H&R Block Inc. reports quarterly results on Monday, it may be a case of robbing Peter to pay Paul in a rush to get paid by Sam.

Uncle Sam, that is. H&R Block typically is profitable for only one quarter of the year because most of its revenue revolves around the April 15 tax-filing deadline.

That still will be the case this time around, but the company’s fiscal third quarter ended Jan. 31 was...

twitter.description: H&R Block’s strongest quarter of the year may have been dented by early filers and fewer returns overall.
twitter.creator: @spencerjakab
